252.question: Which other approaches do they compare their model with?
252.response: {'Answer': 'The paper compares the proposed model with two other models: Akbik et al. (2018) and Link et al. (2012).'}
252.answer: Akbik et al. (2018), Link et al. (2012)

253.question: Which other approaches do they compare their model with?
253.response: {'Answer': 'The paper compares the proposed model with two baselines: (1) a CRF model trained on top of ELMo embeddings, and (2) a BiLSTM-CNN-CRF model.'}
253.answer: They compare to Akbik et al. (2018) and Link et al. (2012).

254.question: What results do they achieve using their proposed approach?
254.response: {'Answer': 'The proposed neural CRF model achieves 88.7% F1-score on OntoNotes and 52.8% F1-score on Wiki (GOLD) datasets. It outperforms previous state-of-the-art models on both datasets.'}
254.answer: F-1 score on the OntoNotes is 88%, and it is 53% on Wiki (gold).

256.question: How do they combine a deep learning model with a knowledge base?
256.response: {'Answer': 'The model is trained on a large dataset of labeled data. The dataset is used to train a deep learning model to identify named entities in text. The model is then combined with a knowledge base to improve its performance.'}
256.answer: Entities from a deep learning model are linked to the related entities from a knowledge base by a lookup.
